The 90s delivered a plethora of fashion trends that made a lasting impression on the industry. From butterfly hair clips to denim overalls, these standout pieces have all made a comeback.This season, the chainmail dress has returned to reign supreme. And we're coming at you with our favourite picks from brands like EGO, Karen Millen, Misspap and 8 Other Reasons - and prices start at just £12.It first gained prominence during Versace’s Autumn/Winter 1994 show, when veteran supermodels Naomi Campbell, Helena Christensen, Linda Evangelista, Claudia Schiffer and Kate Moss rocked co-ordinating gold designs on the catwalk.

Since then, these slinky dresses have continued to grow in popularity, being donned by numerous celebrities over the years – most recently Paris Hilton, Vick Hope, Emily Ratajkowski and Amanda Seyfried, who wore a gold chainmail mini dress to the 2023 Met Gala.It is safe to say the iconic chainmail mini is back with a vengeance. Current styles are racier than ever, typically incorporating a cowl neckline, low back and thigh-high slit. Whether you're looking to make a statement at a formal event or simply want to add some edge to your everyday wardrobe, a chainmail dress is sure to turn heads. And with a variety of styles and colors to choose from, there's something for everyone.
